trans-unit.source: Inverts the specified AND bitmask bitmap by performing a logical NOT operation

seg-source.mrk: Inverts the specified AND bitmask bitmap by performing a logical NOT operation

target.mrk: Inverts the specified AND bitmask bitmap by performing a logical NOT operation

trans-unit.source: Handle to the source bitmap that must be inverted.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the source bitmap that must be inverted.

target.mrk: Handle to the source bitmap that must be inverted.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether to delete the source bitmap after the function is successful, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether to delete the source bitmap after the function is successful, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether to delete the source bitmap after the function is successful, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - The bitmap will be destroyed when the function succeeds.

seg-source.mrk: True - The bitmap will be destroyed when the function succeeds.

target.mrk: True - The bitmap will be destroyed when the function succeeds.

trans-unit.source: False - Do not delete, you must destroy a bitmap when it no longer needed (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must destroy a bitmap when it no longer needed (Default).

target.mrk: False - Do not delete, you must destroy a bitmap when it no longer needed (Default).

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_InvertANDBitmap() creates a 1 bits-per-pixel inverted bitmask DIB from the 1 bits-per-pixel AND bitmask bitmap.

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_InvertANDBitmap() creates a 1 bits-per-pixel inverted bitmask DIB from the 1 bits-per-pixel AND bitmask bitmap.

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_InvertANDBitmap() creates a 1 bits-per-pixel inverted bitmask DIB from the 1 bits-per-pixel AND bitmask bitmap.

trans-unit.source: If the source bitmap is not a 1 bits-per-pixel bitmap, the function fails.

seg-source.mrk: If the source bitmap is not a 1 bits-per-pixel bitmap, the function fails.

target.mrk: If the source bitmap is not a 1 bits-per-pixel bitmap, the function fails.

trans-unit.source: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

seg-source.mrk: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

target.mrk: When you are finished using the bitmap, destroy it using the _WinAPI_DeleteObject() function.

trans-unit.source: Extracts icon and create AND bitmask bitmap

seg-source.mrk: Extracts icon and create AND bitmask bitmap

target.mrk: Extracts icon and create AND bitmask bitmap
